member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ApplicationMenu.KeyTip
member.summary: Returns or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic that is displayed when using keytips.

remarks.p: Key tips are displayed when the ribbon is showing and the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for the application menu conflicts with another tool in the same container, this key tip may be changed.
By default, if the key tip is not set for the application menu, a unique key tip will be auto-generated for the application menu. and must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SettingsBase.Appearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the object's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SettingsBase.HasAppearance
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value determining whether an object has been created.
member.value: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SettingsBase.ToolDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies display style for all on the which determines when the tools text and image are displayed.

remarks.p: The DefaultForToolType setting indicates tools are displayed based on the default for the tool's type and location. The TextOnlyAlways setting specifies tools are always displayed as text. The TextOnlyInMenus setting indicates tools are displayed as their assigned images when located on an , but displayed as text when on a . The ImageAndText setting specifies tools are displayed as both their assigned image and text. The ImageOnlyOnToolbars setting indicates tools are displayed as their assigned images when located on an UltraToolbar, but as both image and text when located on a PopupMenuTool.
Note: This enumeration does not affect tools that are placed on a . The contents of a tool on a ribbon group are based upon the and .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarBase.UnderlyingToolbar
member.summary: Gets the MDI child toolbar that underlies this toolbar.

remarks.p: Note: This property only applies to the and will return null for all other toolbars.

When an MDI merge occurs, a toolbar from the child will be merged into a toolbar on the parent if they have the same key or both have IsMainMenuBar set to True. In this case, the toolbar on the parent will return the toolbar on the child from its UnderlyingToolbar property.

member.value: The MDI child toolbar that underlies this toolbar.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ButtonTool
member.summary: Represents a button, which can perform an action when clicked.

remarks.p: To be notified when an instance of the ButtonTool is clicked, handle the ToolClick event of the ButtonTool. To be notified when any instance of all ButtonTools with the same Key are clicked, handle the event and check the Key of the tool passed into the event arguments.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for all tool objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance.
member.param: The key to assign to the new tool.

remarks.p: If two tools have the same key, they are considered the same logical tool and have a common instance. However, they will each have their own instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.System#IComparable#CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this tool to another.
member.param: The derived object to compare

returns.p: Returns 1 if the passed in tool has a lower , 0 if the tool is the same tool or -1 if the passed in tool has a higher .
If the tools have the same then tools with higher indexes will be given lower priorities. This means that by default tools will be hidden from right to left as the toolbar is shortened.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CompareTo(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase)

returns.p: Returns 1 if the passed in tool has a lower , 0 if the tool is the same tool or -1 if the passed in tool has a higher .
If the tools have the same then tools with higher indexes will be given lower priorities. This means that by default tools will be hidden from right to left as the toolbar is shortened.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ShouldSerializeInstanceProps
member.summary: Determines whether the property is set to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.returns: True if the property is not set to its default value; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ResetInstanceProps
member.summary: Resets all properties to their default values.

remarks.p: This method resets all of the modifiable properties of the InstanceProps object to their default values. Any properties that default to their "use default" setting then take on the settings found in the associated SharedProps object. Invoking this method is the equivalent of invoking the method of the InstanceProps object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ShouldSerializeKey
member.summary: Determines whether the property is set to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.returns: True if the property is not set to its default value; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ShouldSerializeSharedProps
member.summary: Determines whether the property is set to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.returns: True if the property is not set to its default value; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ResetSharedProps
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

remarks.p: This method resets all of the modifiable properties of the SharedProps object to their default values. Note that invoking this method on a single instance of a tool resets SharedProps for all instances of the tool; all instances descended from the same root tool (and the root tool itself) share the same SharedProps object. Invoking this method is the equivalent of invoking the method of the InstanceProps object.

member.summary: This method is called internally to set a reference to this tool on the underlying mdi child tool.
member.returns: The previously attached parent tool.

remarks.p: This is necessary since it is possible to have multiple parent tools referencing a single from the mdi child.
This method is called internally before certain operations to ensure that the has a proper context.

member.summary: Ensures that the is currently in view.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DirtyMetrics
member.summary: Used to notify the that a property has changed that could result in a size change in the tool.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ResetState
member.summary: Resets the to its original state undoing any changes that were made at runtime.

remarks.p: You can invoke this method to remove any end-user customizations to the tool and return it to the state it was in when the application started. Specifically, this method will reset the caption, display style, grouping, visibility and recently-used status of the tool. For PopupMenu tool, invoking this method also resets any customizations that have been performed on the tools of the menu.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the to their default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.AttachedParentTool
member.summary: Returns the parent tool that is currently attached to this MDI child tool.

remarks.p: When you have a tool on a child MDI form, that tool can be merged with the toolbar on the parent MDI form when the child form is maximized. To accomplish this, an invisible placeholder tool is added to the parent form's toolbar for any tool found on a child MDI form's toolbar. The placeholder tool is merely a pointer to the tool on the MDI child form, which is the underlying tool. Properties that have context in the parent form's toolbar, such as position, are handled by the placeholder tool; any other properties set or read at run-time are simply passed through to or from the child form's tool.
The AttachedParentTool property is necessary because it is possible to have multiple parent tools referencing a single .
The method is called internally before certain operations to ensure that the has a proper context.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the location and size of the tool in screen coordinates.
member.remarks: If the tool is not visible an empty rectangle will be returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CaptionResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the property on the and objects, taking into account any customization performed by the end user.

remarks.p: There are several levels at which the Caption property may be set. At run-time, an end user may set the caption of a control using the run-time customizer. Caption may be set through code on the InstanceProps object, which will affect only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. The caption may also be set on the SharedProps object, which will affect all the instances of the tool that occur in the application. Finally, it can be set at the tool level which will be the default setting for all tools of the same type that are added to the application.

These settings exist in an inheritance hierarchy. The end-user defined settings are applied first. If there is no end-user customization, the InstanceProps setting is used. If the InstanceProps property is set ot its "use default" value, the SharedProps setting is used. The default values of the SharedProps object always provide a value that can be used by the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ComponentRole
member.summary: Returns the ComponentRole of the

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CustomizerCaptionResolved
member.summary: Returns the string that will appear in the Customize dialog's 'Commands' list.

remarks.p: The property of the SharedProps object determines the text that will appear in the run-time customizer next to the icon for this tool. This property returns the value that will be applied to this tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CustomizerDescriptionResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the property on the object of the .

remarks.p: The property of the SharedProps object determines the text that will appear in the run-time customizer in the descriptive text area for this tool. This property returns the value that will be applied to this tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DisplayStyleResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the property on the and objects, taking into account any customization performed by the end user.

remarks.p: There are several levels at which the DisplayStyle property may be set. At run-time, an end user may set the display style of a control using the run-time customizer. DisplayStyle may be set through code on the InstanceProps object, which will affect only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. The display style may also be set on the SharedProps object, which will affect all the instances of the tool that occur in the application. Finally, it can be set at the tool level which will be the default setting for all tools of the same type that are added to the application.

These settings exist in an inheritance hierarchy. The end-user defined settings are applied first. If there is no end-user customization, the InstanceProps setting is used. If the InstanceProps property is set ot its "use default" value, the SharedProps setting is used. The default values of the SharedProps object always provide a value that can be used by the control.
Note: This enumeration does not affect tools that are placed on a . The contents of a tool on a ribbon group are based upon the and .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DefaultSize

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.InstanceProps
member.summary: Returns the object which contains properties that are unique to a instance.

remarks.p: UltraWinToolbars represents a tool in two ways, as a root tool and an instance tool. Root tools are the tools that appear in the run-time customizer; their purpose is to create the tools that will appear on a toolbar or menu. Instance tools are the tools that the user actually interacts with; they appear on toolbars and/or menus. Each instance tool is related to exactly one root tool. Each root tool may have multiple instance tools derived from it. For example, a "FileSave" root tool may have two instance tools in an application - one displaying only text and appearing on the File menu, and one displaying only an image and appearing on the Standard toolbar.

Although functionally treated as distinct objects, root and instance tools share a close relationship. Changes made to a root tool will affect all instance tools derived from that root. Changes to an instance tool may affect only the one instance, or they may affect the root tool and by extension other instances of that root.

Because root and instance tools have some features that are shared and some that are unique, UltraWinToolbars splits some of each tool's properties between two objects. Properties that apply to the root tool and all instances of that tool are found on the SharedProps object, which is accessed via the tool's property. As the name suggests, the properties of the SharedProps object are shared across all instances of the tool. A change to one of these properties will affect the root tool and all other instances of the tool.

Properties that affect only a single instance of the tool are found on the InstanceProps object, which is accessed via the tool's property. Although root tools have an InstanceProps property, this property returns Null, as there are no instance properties associated with a root tool.

These properties exist in an inheritance hierarchy, with common properties supporting a "use default" setting to indicate that the value of that property should be inherited. When resolving the property setting for a particular tool instance, the InstanceProps value for a property is applied first. If the InstanceProps property is set to its "use default" value (i.e. there is not InstanceProps value for the property) then the SharedProps setting for the property is used. The default values of the SharedProps object always provide a value that can be used by the control. If for some reason the SharedProps value is set to "use default", the intrinsic value of the root tool is used.

For a complete discussion of the difference between root and instance tools, see the following section of the help: Developers Guide > The Toolset > Controls and Components > WinToolbarsManager > Understanding WinToolbarsManager.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsRootTool
member.summary: Returns whether the is a root (i.e., is in the component's collection).

remarks.p: UltraWinToolbars represents a tool in two ways, as a root tool and an instance tool. Root tools are the tools that appear in the run-time customizer; their purpose is to create the tools that will appear on a toolbar or menu. Instance tools are the tools that the user actually interacts with; they appear on toolbars and/or menus. Each instance tool is related to exactly one root tool. Each root tool may have multiple instance tools derived from it. For example, a "FileSave" root tool may have two instance tools in an application - one displaying only text and appearing on the File menu, and one displaying only an image and appearing on the Standard toolbar.

Although functionally treated as distinct objects, root and instance tools share a close relationship. Changes made to a root tool will affect all instance tools derived from that root. Changes to an instance tool may affect only the one instance, or they may affect the root tool and by extension other instances of that root.

For a complete discussion of the difference between root and instance tools, see the following section of the help: Developers Guide > The Toolset > Controls and Components > WinToolbarsManager > Understanding WinToolbarsManager.
This property will return True for a root tool, False for an instance tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that uniquely identifies an object in a collection.

remarks.p: The Key property is a unique, user-defined object identification string that can be used interchangeably with the Index of an object when accessing it through code. If you attempt to assign a value to the Key property is not unique in the collection, an error will occur.

The value of the Index property of an object can change when objects in the collection are reordered, such as when you add or remove objects. If you expect the Index property to change dynamically, refer to objects in a collection using the Key property. In addition, you can use the Key property to make your program "self-documenting" by assigning meaningful names to the objects in a collection.

You can set the Key property when you use the Add method to add an object to a collection. In some instances, the Key property of an object may be blank if that object does not appear in a collection.

Also, note that the uniqueness of keys is only enforced when the Key property is set to a value. If a collection supports objects with blank keys, that collection may contain multiple objects that whose Key property is empty. In that case, you must use Index property to differentiate between the objects that have blank keys.

remarks.p: The MaxWidth property determines the maximum width the tool can occupy. This property can be set on the SharedProps object to affect all instances of the tool, or on the InstanceProps object to affect only a single instance tool. The InstanceProps setting will take precedence over the SharedProps setting.
This property will return the value that is in effect for the current tool regardless of whether it is the InstanceProps or the SharedProps setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ShortcutResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the property on the object, taking into account any customization performed by the end user.

remarks.p: This property determines the shortcut key value that will be used for the control.

At run-time, an end user may set the shortcut key of a control using the run-time customizer. Shortcut may also be set on the SharedProps object, which will affect all the instances of the tool that occur in the application. These settings exist in an inheritance hierarchy. The end-user defined settings are applied first. If there is no end-user customization, the SharedProps setting is used. The ShortcutResolved property returns the value that is being used by the tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.SpringResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the property on the and objects.

remarks.p: The property specifies whether a tool should alter its width to fill available space on a toolbar (provided the toolbar has this feature enabled.) This property returns the value of Spring that is in effect for the tool, taking into consideration a variety of factors, such as whether the tool has a width than be set and whether the toolbar is currently being customized.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsHiddenByMdiMerge
member.summary: Returns whether the tool should be hidden as the result of an MDI merge.

remarks.p: During MDI merge, tools from toolbars on child MDI forms are merged with their placeholders in the toolbar of the parent MDI form. If there is a tool that you do not want to display in the toolbar of the parent MDI form when the child MDI form is maximized, you can set this property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.InstanceDisplaysImage
member.summary: Returns whether this tool instance displays its image.

remarks.p: The property determines whether a tool should display an image, text or both when placed on a toolbar or menu. Different types of tools have different default settings, and the settings for some tools may be changed by either the developer or the end user.

This property provides a quick way for you to determine whether a particular instance of a tool is displaying an image. This property takes into account the instance's tool type, its DisplayStyle setting and whether it is positioned on a toolbar or menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.InstanceDisplaysText
member.summary: Returns whether this tool instance displays its text.

remarks.p: The property determines whether a tool should display an image, text or both when placed on a toolbar or menu. Different types of tools have different default settings, and the settings for some tools may be changed by either the developer or the end user.

This property provides a quick way for you to determine whether a particular instance of a tool is displaying text. This property takes into account the instance's tool type, its DisplayStyle setting and whether it is positioned on a toolbar or menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.OwnerIsPopup
member.summary: Helper property to determine if the tool is on an owner that is displayed within a dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ParentCollectionOwner
member.summary: Returns the UltraToolbar or PopupMenuTool that owns this tool instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.UltimateOwner
member.summary: Walks up the owner chain looking for the top level owner of the tool.

remarks.p: This property returns the top-level object that owns the tool. This will always be a toolbar or a menu control. If a tool is positioned directly on a toolbar or menu, that is the object returned. If a tool is positioned on a sub-menu (i.e. on a PopupMenu tool) this property will determine which menu the sub-menu descends from and return that object. This is true even if the sub-menu is nested within one or more sub-menus; the top level menu is always returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CaptionPlacement

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CurrentToolSizeInfo

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.ExtraSharedPropsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

Each tool type that wants to store another extra shared props object should override ExtraSharedPropsCount, and in the get accessor, call the base implementation, add one, and return that new number. When accessing the custom extra shared props object, the tool type should use the value of ExtraSharedPropsCount from the base implementation and pass that as the index parameter into either or .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.CanSetDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns whether the InstanceProps.DisplayStyle and SharedProps.DisplayStyle properties can be set.

remarks.p: DisplayStyle determines how the tool appears on the toolbar: whether it shows only an icon, only text or an icon and text. The CanSetDisplayStyle property specifies whether the display style may be set for a tool.

DisplayStyle may be set through code on the object, which will affect the display of only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. DisplayStyle may also be set on the object, which will affect the display of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

Width may be set through code on the object, which will affect the width of only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. Width may also be set on the object, which will affect the width of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DefaultInstanceDisplaysTextOnToolbars
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this tool is capable of displaying text when positioned on a toolbar.

remarks.p: The property determines whether a tool should display an image, text or both when placed on a toolbar or menu. However, different tools have different capabilities for displaying text. This property determines whether the control can display text when it is placed on a toolbar. To quickly determine whether an instance of a tool is actually displaying text, you can use the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DefaultIsFirstInGroup
member.summary: Returns the default property setting appropriate for this tool type.

remarks.p: This property always returns false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.DefaultMergeType

remarks.p: This property returns the default value setting for MergeType. This is the value the property is set to if its setting is not modified at design-time or through code.
This default implementation for this property always returns Replace, the default setting for MergeType.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsControlContainer
member.summary: Returns whether the tool is a container tool that can contain other controls. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property will return True only for tools that can contain controls, such as the and tools. For most controls (button, combo box, etc.) this property will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsContainedControlShared
member.summary: Returns true if the is shared among all instances of the tool.

remarks.p: This property applies only to container tools that host other controls. Use this property to determine whether the control contained by the tool is shared among all instances of the tool or is unique to this instance of the tool.
This property returns True if the control is shared, False if it is unique to the instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsEditValueNullable
member.summary: Returns whether the value can be set to null. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property returns whether the underlying embeddable editor used by the tool will return null (DBNULL) or an empty string in response to the deletion of the contents of the editor.
This is a future expansion property. In the current version of UltraWinToolbars, this property always returns True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsPressed
member.summary: Returns whether the tool is pressed. This applies to tools that have a pressed state such as .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsVisibleOnMenus
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a menu.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a menu. If False, the tool will be visible only on toolbars or not at all.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsVisibleOnRibbonGroup
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the tool type supports being place in a .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsVisibleOnToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a toolbar. If False, the tool will be visible only on menus or not at all.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolBase.IsVisibleOnVerticalToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar that is docked vertically, in either the left or right docking area.

remarks.p: Certain tools (such as the combo box tool) are better suited to appearing in the horizontal layout that is found on a toolbar or menu that is docked at the top or bottom of a form. It is often difficult to display these tools in a vertical toolbar that is docked to the left or right edge of the form. To do so either requires reducing the size of the control enough to impede usability, or increasing the width of the toolbar area enough to interfere with the main body of the application. For this reason, it is easier to simply prevent certain tools from appearing on a vertically-oriented toolbar.
Use this property to determine whether a tool will be visible on a vertically-oriented toolbar. This property returns True if the tool will be visible, False if it will not.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ComboBoxTool
member.summary: Represents a combo box, which contains a list of items in a drop down. Optionally, the combo box can be editable by the keyboard.

remarks.p: To force the of the ComboBoxTool to be one of the items in its list, set the to DropDownList. Otherwise, to let custom input to be entered into the combo box with the keyboard, set DropDownStyle to DropDown.

To be notified when an instance of the ComboBoxTool has its Value changed, handle the ToolValueChanged event of the ComboBoxTool. To be notified when any instance of all ComboBoxTools with the same Key has its Value changed, handle the event and check the Key of the tool passed into the event arguments.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextBoxTool
member.summary: Represents a text box, which can be edited by the end-user.

remarks.p: To be notified when an instance of the TextBoxTool has its changed, handle the ToolValueChanged event of the TextBoxTool. To be notified when any instance of all TextBoxTools with the same Key has its Text changed, handle the event and check the Key of the tool passed into the event arguments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EditorToolBase.IsInEditMode
member.summary: Returns or sets whether this tool is in edit mode.

remarks.p: This property returns True when the tool is currently in edit mode. A tool that is placed into edit mode automatically becomes the active tool. The tool remains in edit mode until the control loses focus or edit mode is terminated through code by setting this property to False.

member.summary: Returns whether the can become the active .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EditorToolBase.CanSetToolWidth
member.summary: Returns whether the property can be set. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: You can use this property to determine whether the width of the control may be set. If False, the control has a fixed width.

Width may be set through code on the object, which will affect the width of only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. Width may also be set on the object, which will affect the width of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EditorToolBase.MinimumSize
member.summary: Returns the minimum possible size of the tool. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property takes into account several factors, such as whether the tool is on a vertical toolbar and the size of the control's caption. Derived classes can override this property.

summary.p: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether width related properties should be serialized for this tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EditorToolBase.ExtraSharedPropsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.EditAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the object's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.HasEditAppearance
member.summary: Indicates whether an object has been created.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.value: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.Locked
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the text in the can be modified by the end-user.

remarks.p: To prevent the user from modifying the contents of the TextEditorToolBase, set this property to True. The text of the tool is still available for other operations (such as copying to the clipboard) when Locked is True. The text of the tool may be modified through code whether this property is set to True or False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.SelectionLength
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of characters selected in the .

remarks.p: This property returns an integer value that indicates the length of the text selection (in characters). You can also use it to change the length of the selection. Used in combination with you can set the selection to any text that exists in the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.SelectionStart
member.summary: Returns or sets the starting point of text selected in the .

remarks.p: This property returns an integer value that indicates the position within the TextEditorToolBase's text where the selection begins. Used in combination with you can set the selection to any text that exists in the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.SelectedText
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the currently selected text in the .

remarks.p: This property returns only the text that is currently selected in the TextEditorToolBase. You can also use this property to replace selected text with a text string that you specify.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.VerticalDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the display style for all instances of the when the it is docked vertically, in the left or right docking areas.

remarks.p: Because there is not enough room to display a text entry area on a vertical toolbar, you have the option of either displaying a button for the TextEditorToolBase when it is on a vertical toolbar, or hiding it altogether. This property specifies which method will be used when the TextEditorToolBase is sited on a vertical toolbar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.CanEditorDisplayVertical
member.summary: Indicates if the editor should be displayed as a button element when on a vertical toolbar.

member.summary: The default accessible role for this type of tool.

member.summary: The default action for this type of tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.DefaultImage
member.summary: Returns the default image for this type of tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.DefaultSize
member.summary: Returns the default size of the tool. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.DefaultTextHAlign
member.summary: Returns the default horizontal alignment for the tool's text when the tool is on a toolbar.

remarks.p: This property will always return HAlign.Left, the default value for the TextEditorToolBase.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.IsVisibleOnVerticalToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar that is docked vertically, in either the left or right docking area.

remarks.p: Because there is not enough room to display a text entry area on a vertical toolbar, you have the option of either displaying a button for the TextEditorToolBase when it is on a vertical toolbar, or hiding it altogether. If the tool is visible on a vertical toolbar as a button, this property will return True. If it is hidden, this property will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.MinimumEditorExtent
member.summary: Returns the minimum size required for the extent of the editor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextEditorToolBase.ExtraSharedPropsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TextBoxTool.PasswordChar
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating how the characters typed by a user are displayed.

remarks.p: The PasswordChar property is used when you want the TextBoxTool to obscure the text entered by the end-user. The character specified for this property will be displayed in place of the alphanumeric characters typed by the user. Common password characters are the asterisk ("*") and the bullet symbol ("", ASCII character 149).

member.summary: Gets/sets whether the edit portion is automatically updated to match an item in the list as new characters are typed.

remarks.p:
When the AutoComplete property is set to true, as characters are typed, the contents of the edit portion is evaluated to determine whether the characters it contains matches the text of any of the items in the dropdown list.
If it does match, the item whose display text it matches becomes the new , and the text in the edit portion is set to that item's display text.
Furthermore, the additional characters that were appended become selected, so that as new characters are typed, the ones added as a result of the item match are removed.
Note: the AutoComplete property is not applicable when the property is DropDownList

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool
member.summary: Represents a control container, which displays a .

remarks.p: If the Control contained by the tool is disposed, the property will automatically be set to null.

Note: By default, only one instance of a ControlContainerTool with a certain Key can exist on the . To allow multiple instances of ControlContainerTools with the same Key to be displayed, set one of their properties to True (setting the property on the of one ControlContainerTool with a Key will change the property on the SharedProps of all ControlContainerTools with the same Key because they have a common SharedProps instance).
Note: The ControlContainerTool cannot be added to the Tools collection of a menu ( and ).

member.param: The key to assign to the new tool.

remarks.p: If two tools have the same key, they are considered the same logical tool and have a common instance. However, they will each have their own instance.

member.summary: Returns whether the tool can be resized.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether the control container can be resized horizontally or not. To keep the container at a fixed width, set this to False. To allow the user or the ToolbarManager to resize the container's width, set this property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.Control
member.summary: Returns the Control attached to the

remarks.p: This property returns a reference to the control inside the ControlContainer. You can use this property to access any of the properties or methods of the control contained by the ControlContainer tool.

member.summary: Returns the name of the Control attached to the

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.VerticalDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the display style for all instances of the when the it is docked vertically, in the left or right docking areas.

remarks.p: Because there is not enough room to display a text entry area on a vertical toolbar, you have the option of either displaying a button for the ControlContainerTool when it is on a vertical toolbar, or hiding it altogether. This property specifies which method will be used when the ControlContainerTool is sited on a vertical toolbar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.CanSetDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns whether the InstanceProps.DisplayStyle and SharedProps.DisplayStyle properties can be set.

remarks.p: Depending on the type of control found in the control container, you may want to specify that only a specific display style is available. If you set this property to False, the user will not be able to change the display style of the control container using the run-time customizer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.CanSetToolWidth
member.summary: Returns whether the property can be set. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: You can use this property to determine whether the width of the control may be set. If False, the control has a fixed width.

Width may be set through code on the object, which will affect the width of only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. Width may also be set on the object, which will affect the width of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

member.summary: Boolean property that specifies whether a is shared among all instances of the tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.IsVisibleOnMenus
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a menu.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a menu. If False, the tool will be visible only on toolbars or not at all.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.IsVisibleOnRibbonGroup
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the tool type supports being place in a .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.IsVisibleOnToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a toolbar. If False, the tool will be visible only on menus or not at all.
At runtime, s whose property is set to null will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.IsVisibleOnVerticalToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar that is docked vertically, in either the left or right docking area.

remarks.p: Certain tools (such as the combo box tool) are better suited to appearing in the horizontal layout that is found on a toolbar or menu that is docked at the top or bottom of a form. It is often difficult to display these tools in a vertical toolbar that is docked to the left or right edge of the form. To do so either requires reducing the size of the control enough to impede usability, or increasing the width of the toolbar area enough to interfere with the main body of the application. For this reason, it is easier to simply prevent certain tools from appearing on a vertically-oriented toolbar.
Use this property to determine whether a tool will be visible on a vertically-oriented toolbar. This property returns True if the tool will be visible, False if it will not.
At runtime, s whose property is set to null will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.MinimumSize
member.summary: Returns the minimum possible size of the tool. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property returns a Drawing.Size object that indicates the minimum possible dimensions of the control. Minimum sized is based on the several factors, including the orientation of toolbar that holds the tool and the size of the control the tool contains.
Derived classes can override this property.

summary.p: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether width related properties should be serialized for this control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.ToolWithContainedControl
member.summary: Returns the tool instance that currently has the re-parented to it.

remarks.p: This will return null except for tools that contain controls, such as the and the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ControlContainerTool.ExtraSharedPropsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle
member.summary: Enumerator used to specify the style used to draw a popup tool's dropdown arrow. Also determines which part of the tool should be clicked to drop down the tool.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle.Default
member.summary: The tool is displayed in its default style.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle.None
member.summary: No dropdown arrow is displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle.Standard
member.summary: A standard downward-pointing dropdown arrow is displayed to the right of the tool's image and/or text when on a toolbar, and a standard right-pointing arrow is displayed when on a menu.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle.Segmented
member.summary: A standard downward-pointing dropdown arrow is displayed to the right of the tool's image and/or text in a separate boxed-off area when on a toolbar and a standard right-pointing arrow with a dividing line to the left of it is displayed when on a menu. Clicking on the arrow drops down the tool. Clicking on the image and/or text area fires the event.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.DropDownArrowStyle.SegmentedStateButton
member.summary: A standard downward-pointing dropdown arrow is displayed to the right of the tool's image and/or text in a separate boxed-off area when on a toolbar and a standard right-pointing arrow with a dividing line to the left of it is displayed when on a menu. Clicking on the arrow drops down the tool. Clicking on the image and/or text area fires the event and toggles the state.

member.summary: Enumeration indicating the styles of the progress bar.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ProgressBarToolStyle.Default
member.summary: By default, the filled area of the progress bar will render using the system themes.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ProgressBarToolStyle.System
member.summary: The filled area will be rendered using the system themes if is true and the operating system has themes enabled. Otherwise, the Continuous style is used by default.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ProgressBarToolStyle.Continuous
member.summary: The filled area's and is rendered using a solid bar.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ProgressBarToolStyle.Segmented
member.summary: The filled area's and is rendered using segments [bars].

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ProgressBarToolStyle.SegmentedPartial
member.summary: The filled area's and is rendered using segments [bars]. This differs from Segmented in that the last bar may appear smaller than the previous bars even when the fill is not complete.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager
member.summary: Class for managing an UltraToolbar's events. It maintains an enabled flag for each event as well as a nested 'in progress' count and it exposes events for firing each event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.#ctor(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: The toolbars manager to which the event manager applies.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.InProgress(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarEventIds)
member.summary: Returns True if the event is in progress (in progress count > 0).
member.param: A value indicating the event to check.

remarks.p: Use this method to determine whether the code of an event is currently being executed. You may want to know whether an event is occurring before disabling it.
The "in progress" count is used to account for recursive calls to events. You can use it to determine how many nested calls to an event have been made and which level of recursion is now executing.

member.returns: True if the specified event is currently being fired; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.IsEnabled(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarEventIds)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified event is enabled.
member.param: A value indicating the event to check.
member.returns: True if the specified event is enabled; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.SetEnabled(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarEventIds,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the enabled state of a specific event.
member.param: A value indicating the event to modify.
The new enabled state to assign to the event.

remarks.p: Before setting an event to disabled, you should use to check whether the event is currently occurring.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.IsEnabled(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EventGroups)
member.summary: Returns true if all events in the group are enabled.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarsEventManager.SetEnabled(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.EventGroups,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets all events in the group to enabled or disabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the error text.

remarks.p: This is the text that will be displayed in the error dialog box. You can modify this property to change what is displayed in the error dialog box. To prevent the error dialog box from displaying, set the property to true.

member.summary: ReadOnly. True if the tool is being forced to exit edit mode. If this is true then will be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolEditErrorEventArgs.RestoreOriginalValue
member.summary: Whether to restore the value in the tool to original value of the tool before entering edit mode. Default value is true.

remarks.p: RestoreOriginalValue indicates whether to restore the original value in the tool to the value before the tool entered edit mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolEditErrorEventArgs.ShowErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether an error message should be displayed to the end user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolEditErrorEventArgs.StayInEditMode
member.summary: Indicates whether to stay in edit mode. Default value is true.

remarks.p: Note: If StayInEditMode is true, then the tool won't exit the edit mode unless the is true in which case the tool will exit the edit mode regardless.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar
member.summary: Represents a toolbar providing navigational capabilities.

remarks.p: This toolbar will always appear above all other toolbars, with the exception of the .

Note: The NavigationToolbar will not serialize the navigation history when saving the toolbars layout. If the history needs to be saved to be loaded at a later date, the information is available through the , , and properties. To load this information, use the method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar.InitializeHistory(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationHistoryItem[],Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationHistoryItem[],Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationHistoryItem)
member.summary: Creates the navigation history from the specified parameters.
member.param: An array of objects. Can be null.
An array of objects. Can be null.
The to set as the current item. Cannot be null.

remarks.p: The elements in each of the history arrays should be ordered by their navigation history. For example, the first item of the back history array should be the element that will appear at the bottom of the recent files list; in other words, this should be the item that is the furthest back from the current item. It may be easiest to think of ordering the elements as a timeline, where each array is ordered from oldest to newest.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar.NavigateBack
member.summary: Navigate one step back through the history.

remarks.p: Note: The property should be checked before attempting to call this method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar.NavigateBack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Navigates up to the specified number of places back in the history.
member.param: The number of items back to navigate to.

remarks.p: If there are fewer items in the back history than the number of places specified, this method will navigate as far as possible.
Note: The property should be checked before attempting to call this method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar.NavigateForward
member.summary: Navigate one step forward through the history.

remarks.p: Note: The property should be checked before attempting to call this method.

member.summary: Navigates up to the specified number of places forward in the history.
member.param: The number of items forward to navigate to.

remarks.p: If there are fewer items in the forward history than the number of places specified, this method will navigate as far as possible.
Note: The property should be checked before attempting to call this method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.NavigationToolbar.NavigateTo(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a NavigationHistoryItem with the specified parameters and sets it as the current item.
member.param: The text to display when the item is shown in the recent history menu. Cannot be null or empty.
An optional object to associate with the item.

remarks.p: Similarly to how the navigation works in an explorer window in Vista, when navigating to a new item, a new path is started and the forward history is cleared.

member.summary: Sets the provided item as the current navigation item.

remarks.p: Similarly to how the navigation works in an explorer window in Vista, when navigating to a new item, a new path is started and the forward history is cleared.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.MenuSettings.IconAreaAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the appearance of the area behind the icons on a menu when using Windows XP style.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.MenuSettings.HasIconAreaAppearance
member.summary: Indicates whether an object has been created.
member.value: Returns true when the Appearance object for the property has been created.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.MenuSettings.IconAreaExpandedAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the appearance of the area behind the icons on a menu when using Windows XP style. Only used for menu items that are not 'recently used' but are currently being shown.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

The property specifies the text displayed in the side strip.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.MenuSettings.LabelDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the s within the menu should be displayed as standard tools or as headers overlaying the icon area of the menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.MenuSettings.PopupStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines whether a is displayed as a menu or a toolbar.

remarks.p: The Menu setting indicates that the PopupMenuTool is displayed as a standard menu. The Toolbar setting specifies that the PopupMenuTool is displayed as a floating toolbar.

member.summary: Returns the button style that should be used to render the borders of the element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.CanSetDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns whether the InstanceProps.DisplayStyle and SharedProps.DisplayStyle properties can be set.

remarks.p: DisplayStyle determines how the tool appears on the toolbar: whether it shows only an icon, only text or an icon and text. The CanSetDisplayStyle property specifies whether the display style may be set for a popup tool.

DisplayStyle may be set through code on the object, which will affect the display of only the single instance of the popup tool for which it is set. DisplayStyle may also be set on the object, which will affect the display of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

member.summary: The default action for this type of tool.

member.summary: Returns whether the tool should be drawn as though it is active.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.IsVisibleOnRibbonGroup
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the tool type supports being place in a .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.ShouldDisplayToolTip
member.summary: Returns whether a ToolTip should be displayed for the when the mouse hovers over it. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: Whether the PopupToolBase displays a tooltip depends on the that is selected for the tool. A 'segmented' style will display a tooltip; other styles will not.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.Checked
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the is currently checked.

remarks.p: State button tools may be in one of two states: checked or unchecked. The Checked property determines the state of the tool. If set to True, the control is checked (pressed). If set to False, the control is unchecked (un-pressed). (Depending on its placement and The tool may not actually display a checkmark.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.DropDownArrowStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style of the dropdown arrow for the .

remarks.p: The style of the dropdown arrow can be set to None, Standard or Segmented. If it is None, no dropdown arrow is displayed. If it is Standard, a standard downward-pointing dropdown arrow is displayed to the right of the tool's image and/or text when on a toolbar, and a standard right-pointing arrow is displayed when on a menu. If it is Segmented, a standard downward-pointing dropdown arrow is displayed to the right of the tools image and/or text in a separate boxed-off area when on a toolbar, and a standard right-pointing arrow with a dividing line to the left is displayed when on a menu.
Clicking on the dropdown arrow displays the popup portion of the tool. Clicking on the image and/or text area fires the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.DropDownArrowStyleResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved for this tool.

remarks.p: This property returns the DropDownArrowStyle that will be used when displaying the popup tool, taking into account any MDI merging that has taken place.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns whether the is currently open (i.e. dropped down).

remarks.p: If this property returns True, the popup portion of the control is currently being displayed to the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.PopupToolBase.KeyTipForSegmentedButton
member.summary: Returns or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic that is displayed for the segmented drop down arrow when using keytips.

remarks.p: Key tips are displayed when the ribbon is showing and the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for the segmented button conflicts with another tool in the same container, this key tip may be changed.
By default, if the key tip is not set for the segmented button, a unique key tip will be auto-generated for the segmented button. and must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.FontListTool.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones the tool and returns the new tool instance.

remarks.p: Note: It is recommended that derived tool types override Clone and . The Clone override should create a new instance of the derived tool type and call InitializeFrom on the new tool instance, passing in the current tool and .

member.param: If True, returns a clone of the tool that can serve as an instance of the tool, sharing the same SharedProps object. If False, returns a tool that can be used as a new tool, with a clone of the original SharedProps object.
member.returns: A copy of the tool which may have a cloned SharedProps, depending on the value of .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.FontListTool.MruItems
member.summary: Returns a collection of strings representing the most recent font names chosen using the tool.

remarks.p: The MRUList feature of the FontList tool provides a list of the items most recently selected by the end user. This list makes it easy for the end user to quickly select frequently-accessed fonts. The control will automatically create the MRU list and display it at the top of the list when the FontList is dropped down. (This behavior can be seen in the Font tool found on the Formatting toolbar of Microsoft Word.)

You can use the MruItems property to work with the contents of the MRU list. You can determine which fonts the user has selected, pre-populate the list with specific entries for commonly-used fonts, or save and restore the contents of the MRU List between instances of your application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.FontListTool.ValueList
member.summary: Returns or sets the object associated with the .

remarks.p: The ValueList object is used to store the items that appear in the dropdown portion of the combo. Each ValueList contains a series of that correspond to the individual items on the list.

In the case of the FontList tool, the items listed in the dropdown portion of the control are the fonts installed on the system. This list is automatically populated by the control, based on the list of fonts enumerated by the system.
Note: Because the dropdown list is populated automatically, the ValueList property is effectively read-only for the ; attempting to set the property will throw an exception.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.FontListTool.CloneValueListItems
member.summary: Returns whether the ValueListItems in the ValueList associated with the tool should be cloned when the tool is cloned.

member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.InstanceProps
member.summary: Class which exposes properties that are specific to a single instance of a derived object.

remarks.p: All tools in the same with the same Key and type will have the same object. For example, setting the Caption on the SharedProps of a button tool with the key "Exit" in a file menu will change the caption of all button tools with the key "Exit" on all menus and toolbars.

The InstanceProps of a tool take precedence over the SharedProps. When resolving a property for a tool the value of the property on the InstanceProps will be checked first. If it is default, the value of the property on the SharedProps will be used. If that is also default, the most appropriate default value for the tool's type will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolPropsBase.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that specifies the caption of either all tools or a specific instance.

remarks.p: When set for the object, this property specifies the caption for all instances of a tool that have not had their caption explicitly set. When set for the object, this property specifies the caption for one instance of a tool.
The caption of a specific tool instance can be changed by the user during customization. The property is used to resolve the caption of a tool.
When the property is not explicitly set, the value of this property serves as the default tool tip.

member.exception: The property is modified at design-time for a tool in an defined on a base Form or UserControl. Inherited tools must be modified at run-time or at design-time through the designer of the Form or UserControl they were created on.
member.value: The text that specifies the caption of either all tools or a specific instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolPropsBase.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the display style for either all tools or a specific instance.

remarks.p: When set for the object, this property specifies the display style for all instances of a tool that have not had their display style explicitly set. When set for the object, this property specifies the display style for one instance of a tool.
The display style of a specific tool instance can be changed by the user during customization. The property is used to resolve the display style of a tool.
Note: This value does not affect tools that are placed on a . The contents of a tool on a ribbon group are based upon the and .

member.exception: The property is modified at design-time for a tool in an defined on a base Form or UserControl. Inherited tools must be modified at run-time or at design-time through the designer of the Form or UserControl they were created on.
The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The display style for either all tools or a specific instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolPropsBase.KeyTip
member.summary: Gets or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tool when using keytips.

remarks.p: When set for the object, this property specifies the key tip for all instances of a tool that have not had their key tip explicitly set. When set for the object, this property specifies the key tip for one instance of a tool.
Key tips are displayed when the ribbon is showing and the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for a tool conflicts with another tool in the same container, this key tip may be changed.
By default, if the key tip is not set for a tool, a unique key tip will be auto-generated for the tool. and must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

The property is modified at design-time for a tool in an defined on a base Form or UserControl. Inherited tools must be modified at run-time or at design-time through the designer of the Form or UserControl they were created on.
member.value: A string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tool when using keytips.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.LabelTool
member.summary: Represents a label which displays text. The label is for display only and does not respond to clicks.

remarks.p: All LabelTool instance within a menu can be made to appear as headers to section off the tools beneath them. This can be accomplished by setting the LabelDisplayStyle property of the Settings on the or to Header. To make all LabelTool instances display as headers by default, set the LabelDisplayStyle property of the to Header.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool
member.summary: Represents a list of menu items which may change in number throughout the run of the application.

remarks.p: The ListTool always has one selected item, which can be determined or specified with the or properties.
Optionally, the selected item in the ListTool can display a check mark next to it by setting to True.
Note: The ListTool can only be placed on a menu ( or ).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.ListToolItems
member.summary: Returns a of objects, one for each in the .

remarks.p: The list portion of a List tool is made up ListToolItem objects. These objects determine the text that will be displayed in the list, the value of the item (which can be different from the displayed text) and the Appearance of the item. Use this property to access the collection of all the ListToolItem objects present in the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.ListToolItemsInternal
member.summary: This is for internal use only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.MaxItemsToDisplay
member.summary: Returns or sets the maximum number of list items that will be displayed.

remarks.p: Use this property to limit the number of items displayed in the list. For example, when displaying a list of recently used files, you may only want to present the user with the five most recent selections. This property does not limit the number of items that may be added to the list, only how many items will be displayed.

When a list contains more items than the number specified by MaxItemsToDisplay, a "More Items..." option appears at the bottom of the list. The user can select that option to display the entire list in the More Items dialog.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.MoreItemsText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text displayed in the "More Items..." entry.

remarks.p: When there are more items added to a list than can be displayed at one time, a "more items" option appears at the bottom of the list, giving the user the opportunity to view the items that would not fit on the list initially. You can use this property to set the text that will appear on the list to indicate that more items are available. When the user clicks the "more items" text, the More Items dialog opens to display all of the items in the list.
This property defaults to a text string of "More Items...".

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.SelectedItem
member.summary: Returns the currently selected ListToolItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.SelectedItemIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets the index of the currently selected ListToolItem.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine which ListToolItem is currently selected. Alternately, you can change the current selection in the ListTool by assigning the index of an existing item to this property.

Note that if you have enabled the display of checkmarks in the list via the property, then setting SelectedItemIndex to its current value will toggle the state of the checkbox. This is analogous to clicking a checked item. Since it is already selected (checked) clicking it again will unselect (uncheck) it. You can set this property to -1 to unselect any item that may be selected, regardless of whether checkboxes are being displayed.
Assigning a value to this property causes the event to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ListTool.DefaultMoreItemsText
member.summary: Returns the default string for the property.

remarks.p: When there are more items added to a list than can be displayed at one time (as determined by a "more items" option appears at the bottom of the list, giving the user the opportunity to view the items that would not fit on the list initially. This property indicates the default text that will appear on the list to indicate that more items are available, which is "More Items...". To customize the string that will appear, use the property.

remarks.p: For the ListTool this property will always return False.

member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.
